* The {@code Sigma} class serves as the main application class, handling
* the initialization, command processing, and execution of the task management
* application. It interacts with the user through the {@code Ui} class,
* manages tasks using the {@code TaskList} class, and handles file storage
* Constructs a {@code Sigma} object and initializes the required components.

* Exits the application by saving the task list to a file, closing the

* The {@code Ui} class handles all interactions with the user.
* It is responsible for displaying messages, receiving user input, and
* Constructs a {@code Ui} object and initializes the {@code Scanner} for reading user input.
* Reads and returns the user's input after trimming any leading or trailing whitespace.
* @return The trimmed input from the user.
* Closes the {@code Scanner} to free up resources.
* Displays the welcome message when the application starts.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Displays an error message when a {@code SigmaException} is thrown.
* @param e The exception containing the error message.
* Displays a goodbye message when the application is about to exit.
System.out.println("Catch ya on the flip side, my dude! See ya soon!");
* @param tasks The list of tasks to display.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been marked as done.
* @param task The task that has been marked as done.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been marked as not done.
* @param task The task that has been marked as not done.
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been added to the list.
* @param task The task that has been added.
* @param numberOfTasks The current number of tasks in the list.
public void showAddedTask(Task task, int numberOfTasks) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + numberOfTasks + " tasks in the list.");

* Represents the various command types that can be issued in the Sigma application.
* Each command corresponds to a specific action the application can perform.
BYE, LIST, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, MARK, UNMARK, DELETE, FIND;
* Checks if a given command word is a valid command.
* @param commandWord the command word to be checked
* @return {@code true} if the command word is valid, {@code false} otherwise
* The {@code SigmaEmptyTaskListException} is thrown when an operation is attempted
* Returns a string representation of the exception, including the
* base exception message and an indication that the task list is empty.
* @return A string message indicating the task list is empty.
return String.format("%s Task list is empty.", super.toString());
* Thrown when invalid arguments are provided to a command in the Sigma application.
* Constructs a SigmaInvalidArgException with the specified command type.
* @param command the command type associated with the invalid arguments
* Returns a detailed error message indicating the correct usage of the command.
* @return a string representing the error message with usage instructions
* The {@code SigmaInvalidDateException} class is a custom exception that extends
* the {@code SigmaException} class. This exception is thrown when an invalid
* date format is encountered for specific command types within the application.

*

This exception provides detailed error messages depending on the command type,
* guiding the user on the correct usage of the command with the appropriate date

*
  • {@code DEADLINE}: Requires a date in the format "DD/MM/YY HH:MM" following the description.

*
  • {@code EVENT}: Requires a start and end date in the format "DD/MM/YY HH:MM".

*

If the command type is not supported, a generic invalid date message is returned.
* Constructs a new {@code SigmaInvalidDateException} with the specified command type.
* @param command the command type that triggered this exception
* Returns a string representation of this exception, providing a detailed message

*

If the command type is {@code DEADLINE} or {@code EVENT}, the message will
* include the correct usage format for the date. For other command types, a generic
* @return a string representation of this {@code SigmaInvalidDateException}
String message = "%s Invalid Date format. Usage: %s";
* The {@code SigmaInvalidDateRangeException} class is a custom exception that extends
* the {@code SigmaException} class. This exception is thrown when an invalid date range
* is encountered, specifically when the end date is earlier than the start date.

*

This exception provides a clear error message indicating that the end date cannot
* be earlier than the start date, helping users to correct the date range in their input.
* Returns a string representation of this exception, providing a detailed message
* that explains the invalid date range.

*

The message indicates that the end date cannot be earlier than the start date,
* guiding users to correct the input.
* @return a string representation of this {@code SigmaInvalidDateRangeException}
return String.format("%s End date cannot be earlier than start date.", super.toString());
